title: 'JWoww' announces pregnancy alongside marriage
text: Oh, baby! Growing celebrity families Updated 1944 GMT (0244 HKT) October 19, 2015 36 photos: Growing celebrity families "Jersey Shore's" Jenni "JWoww" Farley and partner Roger Mathews had a couple big announcements Sunday, October 18: not only did they tie the knot in New Jersey, but they also announced that Farley is pregnant with their second child . Here's a look at some other growing celebrity families. Hide Caption 1 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Supermodel Chrissy Teigen announced October 12 on Instagram that she and her husband, singer John Legend, are expecting their first child. "I look forward to all the belly touching!" she wrote. Hide Caption 2 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Actress Brooklyn Decker and her husband, tennis star Andy Roddick, welcomed their first child -- a boy -- on September 30 in Austin, Texas, according to US Weekly . Hide Caption 3 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Morena Baccarin ("Homeland") and Ben McKenzie ("The O.C.") are expecting their first child, Baccarin's rep confirmed. The on- and off-screen couple co-star on the hit Fox series "Gotham." Hide Caption 4 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Blake Lively and Ryan Reynolds welcomed their first child together in December, according to People magazine . Lively, 27, and Reynolds, 38, named their new daughter James. Lively said, "This is the happiest time in my life, and I could say that every day. I often feel like, 'I can't believe I'm experiencing this.' " Hide Caption 5 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Country singer Jessie James Decker and her husband Eric Decker of the New York Jets welcomed baby Eric Thomas Decker ll on Sept 3. The singer showed off her newest addition on Facebook. Hide Caption 6 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Singer-actress Teyana Taylor and NBA player Iman Shumpert are expecting a baby girl who they plan to name Iman Jr., according to a note the Cleveland Cavalier posted on Instagram along with a sonogram picture. "I couldn't be more happy than to share my first child with the woman I intended to have my family with," wrote Shumpert. Hide Caption 7 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Looks like Ne-Yo may soon be crafting some lullabies. The singer/producer and his lady love, Crystal Renay, announced on Instagram on Sunday, August 30, that they are expecting. Ne-Yo has a son and a daughter with his former fiancee, Monyetta Shaw. Hide Caption 8 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families "Elementary" actress Lucy Liu announced Thursday, August 27, on Instagram that she's welcomed a baby boy. "Introducing the new little man in my life, my son Rockwell Lloyd Liu. In ❤️!" she wrote. The child was born via a surrogate. A rep reports, "Mom and baby are healthy and happy." Hide Caption 9 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Singer Kelly Clarkson announced her pregnancy on Wednesday, August 19, during a concert at Los Angeles' Staples Center. Hide Caption 10 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Billy Joel and his new wife, Alexis, welcomed a baby girl into their family on Wednesday, August 12. Nearly two months after the couple married, Della Rose Joel entered the world at 7 pounds, 6.5 ounces. Her big sister is Alexa Ray, Joel's 29-year-old daughter with ex-wife Christie Brinkley. Hide Caption 11 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Big news for Jacob Pechenik and Zooey Deschanel: The couple welcomed a "New Girl" in the form of a daughter in July. The pair also is said to have gotten secretly married! Hide Caption 12 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Rapper-actor Ice-T and wife Coco announced they're expecting a baby ahead of the debut of their talk show for the E! network this month. The couple shared the news on Twitter. This will be the first child for the pair. Ice-T has children from a previous relationship. Hide Caption 13 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families "Real Housewives of Atlanta" star Kandi Burrus and husband Todd Tucker are expecting their first child together. "We're so thrilled to announce the news of our bundle of joy, it's a dream come true," she told E! News. They each have daughters from other relationships. Hide Caption 14 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Josh Duggar tweeted on July 19 to welcome the arrival of baby daughter Meredith Grace. Duggar and wife Anna are the parents of three other children. His family's reality show, "19 Kids and Counting," was canceled shortly before the announcement, after accusations that Josh molested young girls when he was in his teens. Hide Caption 15 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Jay Cutler and Kristin Cavallari are adding a little girl to their team. The Chicago Bears quarterback and his wife, a former reality TV star, announced the sex of baby number 3 via social media in July. The couple are parents to sons Camden, 2, and Jaxon, 1. Hide Caption 16 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Reality TV star and author Bristol Palin, daughter of former vice presidential candidate Sarah Palin, announced Thursday, June 25, that she is pregnant with her second child. She recently ended an engagement to Medal of Honor recipient Dakota Meyer. Her former fiance, Levi Johnston, is the father of her son, Tripp. Hide Caption 17 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Jennifer Love Hewitt and husband Brian Hallisay have added to their family. E! reports that son Atticus James Hallisay was born on June 24. He joins big sister Autumn James Hallisay. Hide Caption 18 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Reality TV star Kim Kardashian and rapper Kanye West announced that they're expecting a baby boy. Kardashian and West have a 2-year-old daughter, North. Hide Caption 19 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Alec Baldwin and wife Hilaria announced on social media Wednesday that they had welcomed their second child, a son named Rafael Thomas. He joins big sister Carmen Gabriela. Hide Caption 20 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Actress Lisa Osbourne and husband Jack Osbourne are now the parents of daughter No. 2, Andy Rose, born June 13. Big sister Pearl, 3, gave fans a giggle posing on Instagram with a doll in her shirt to mimic her mom. Hide Caption 21 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families "Soul surfer" Bethany Hamilton and husband Adam Dirks announced via Instagram that they are the new parents of son Tobias, "born June 1st, 7.9 lbs. and 21" Long." The photo caption says, "He is named after his great grandpa Tobias meaning 'The goodness of God.' " Hide Caption 22 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Benedict Cumberbatch and wife Sophie Hunter welcomed their first child in June, the actor's representative told People . "Benedict Cumberbatch and Sophie Hunter are delighted to announce the arrival of their beautiful son." The couple married on Valentine's Day on the Isle of Wight in England. Hide Caption 23 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Leighton Meester and Adam Brody got married in a secret ceremony in February 2014 , and the pair kept their growing family just as quiet. Photographers captured the "Gossip Girl" star sporting a baby bump in May. Hide Caption 24 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Justin Timberlake and his wife, Jessica Biel, are now parents. The celebrity couple announced the arrival of their first child, Silas Randall Timberlake, in statements to People . The singer had used his 34th birthday to announce news of the impending arrival in a social media post. Hide Caption 25 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Singer Billy Joel, 65, and Alexis Roderick, 33, are expecting their first child "this summer," a rep for Joel told Us Weekly and other media outlets. Hide Caption 26 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Jill Duggar Dillard and husband Derick Dillard had a bit of a wait to become parents, but it's happened. According to People, son Israel David was more than a week late when he was born on April 6. Hide Caption 27 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Oprah-approved interior designer Nate Berkus, left, and his partner, Jeremiah Brent, welcomed baby girl Poppy Brent-Berkus via surrogate on March 23. "We are so excited to finally be a family of 3!" Berkus wrote on Facebook. Hide Caption 28 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Mila Kunis and Ashton Kutcher welcomed their new addition, baby girl Wyatt Isabelle, on October 1. In March, Kutcher complained on Facebook that not enough public men's restrooms have diaper changing tables. Hide Caption 29 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Country music star Carrie Underwood, 31, revealed a photo of her newborn son on Twitter on Tuesday, March 3. "Tiny hands and tiny feet...God has blessed us with an amazing gift! Isaiah Michael Fisher - born February 27," she wrote on the social media site. It is the first child for Underwood and husband Mike Fisher, who plays in the NHL. Hide Caption 30 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families "As I Lay Me Down" singer Sophie B. Hawkins revealed to People magazine that she's pregnant at age 50. Hawkins said she wants a sibling for her 6-year-old son, Dashiell, and feels healthy and strong enough for a second child. She used a frozen embryo with her own egg and donor sperm to conceive. Hide Caption 31 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Shakira and her athlete beau, Gerard Pique, welcomed son Sasha Piqué Mebarak on January 29. "The hospital confirmed that both mother and child are in excellent health," reads a post on Shakira's website. The couple's first child, son Milan, was born in January 2013. Hide Caption 32 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Vanessa Minnillo and Nick Lachey also welcomed their first daughter on January 5. They named their wee one Brooklyn Elisabeth Lachey. Big brother Camden was born in 2012. Hide Caption 33 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Actress Zoe Saldana and husband Marco Perego announced in early January that they had welcomed twin boys Cy and Bowie. Hide Caption 34 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families "Fargo" actor Adam Goldberg and girlfriend Roxanne Daner are expecting a a baby. Goldberg said during the "WTF Podcast with Marc Maron" that the couple had a stillborn child about a year and a half ago and have kept this pregnancy quiet. "We weren't going to tell anybody," he said. "I mean, it's obvious. She's gigantic. But we weren't going to tell anyone unless you ran into her." Hide Caption 35 of 36 36 photos: Growing celebrity families Newlyweds Evan Ross and Ashlee Simpson are expecting their first child together. Simpson also has a 6-year-old son with former husband Pete Wentz of Fall Out Boy. Ross, the actor son of Diana Ross, and Simpson, a singer and the younger sister of pop star Jessica Simpson, tied the knot in August. Hide Caption 36 of 36 Jenni "JWoww" Farley is pregnant with her second child, announced the same day as she wed Roger Mathews. More from Entertainment
